content:
Hi Everyone,

I’m Kapil. I currently work on crypto forensics and blockchain analysis, including running and instrumenting full nodes and tracing execution-level data.
Through this work, I’ve developed a strong interest in Ethereum protocol development. 

My plan is to deepen my theoretical understanding (Eth2 book, epf.wiki, specs) while simultaneously working hands-on with the Geth execution client.

Since you people already worked extensively in this area, I’d really value your perspective, does this sound like the right direction to transition into a protocol engineering role, or is there something you’d suggest I prioritize differently to shorten the path?

Thanks for your time, I’d greatly appreciate any guidance.

Best regards,
Kapil
